alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Gove; Graham; Greeley; Logan; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Sherman; Thomas; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued October 12 at 5:19PM CDT until October 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ FRIDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts around 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas. * WHEN...Until noon MDT /1 PM CDT/ Friday. The strongest winds are expected late this evening through late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property and cause power outages. High winds will also create hazardous travel conditions, particularly for high profile vehicles on west to east routes such as Interstate 70. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Reductions in visibility associated with blowing dust are possible late this afternoon and evening as winds strengthen from the northwest.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by strong northwesterly winds. High dust concentrations can aggravate asthma and cause respiratory problems, especially in children, the elderly or those with pre-existing respiratory conditions. The Kansas Department of Health and Environment recommends taking preventative measures such as staying indoors or wearing protective breathing masks, if outside.
